boardgame.description: The Dwarf King (Le Roi des Nains) is a trick-taking game played with a deck of 53 cards: three suits (Dwarves, Goblins and Knights) of thirteen cards each and fourteen special cards. The game also includes twenty contract tiles._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game is played over seven rounds. At the start of a round, the dealer randomly draws one special card, reads it to all the players, shuffles it into the deck, then deals the deck out evenly to all players. (The dealer for the first round is the game's owner; for subsequent rounds, the dealer is the one who took the 5 of Dwarves in the previous round.) The player who receives the 5 of Knights draws a contract tile, reads it, then chooses one of the two scoring rules on it to apply for that round._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player holding the 5 of Goblins leads on the first trick. Players must follow suit if possible, and the game includes no trump. The highest card played of the suit led wins the trick and leads to the next trick. Once all cards have been played, players tally their points (possibly negative), remove the special card and contract tile from the game, then shuffle for the next round._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The player who scores the most points over seven rounds wins the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Roots to Barbu_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

IELLO (IEL51022) The Dwarf King (Le Roi des Nains) is a trick-taking game played with a deck of 53 cards: three suits (Dwarves, Goblins and Knights) of thirteen cards each and fourteen special cards. The game also includes twenty contract tiles. The game is played over seven rounds. At the start of a round, the dealer randomly draws one special card, reads it to all the players, shuffles it into the deck, then deals the deck out evenly to all players. (The dealer for the first round is the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s owner; for subsequent rounds, the dealer is the one who took the 5 of Dwarves in the previous round.) The player who receives the 5 of Knights draws a contract tile, reads it, then chooses one of the two scoring rules on it to apply for that round. The player holding the 5 of Goblins leads on the first trick. Players must follow suit if possible and the game includes no trump. The highest card played of the suit led wins the trick and leads to the next trick. Once all cards have been played, players tally their points (possibly negative), remove the special card and contract tile from the game, then shuffle for the next round. The player who scores the most points over seven rounds wins the game.

Only played once. #General: All of my games come from a passionate boardgaming household with no pets and no smoking Usually they are packed with sorting boxes and zip bags to ease and shorten ahe setup and break down time I only ship insured! #Versand nach Deutschland (Post/DHL, alle Preise in Euro): Einschreiben (Versicherung = 20,00 €): Großbrief (bis 0,5 kg): 4 € Maxibrief (bis 1,0 kg): 5 € Maxibrief (bis 2,0 kg): 7,5 € Zusatzversicherung: 2€ pro 100€ Versicherung Paket (bis 2,0 kg): 5 € Paket (bis 10,0 kg): 6 € Paket (bis 20,0 kg): 11 € Paket (bis 31,5 kg): 13 € Bis 500 € versichert #International Shipping (DHL, all prices in Euro):: Inscribed letter (insured up to 35,00 €) Letter (up to 0,5 kg): 6,5 € worldwide Letter (up to 1,0 kg): 11 € worldwide Letter (up to 2,0 kg): 21 € worldwide ### extra insurance: add 2 € for every additional 100,00 € Parcel (up to 2,0 kg): 15 € (only EU) --_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; insured up to 500 € Parcel (up to 5,0 kg): 17 € (EU) or 30 € (Rest of Europe) or 35 € (USA/CAN) oder 45 € (Rest of World) Parcel (up to 10,0 kg): 22 € (EU) or 35 € (Rest of Europe) or 50 € (USA/CAN) oder 60 € (Rest of World) Parcel (up to 20,0 kg): 32 € (EU) or 50 € (Rest of Europe) or 70 € (USA/CAN) oder 95 € (Rest of World) Parcel (up to 31,5 kg): 42 € (EU) or 55 € (Rest of Europe) or 95 € (USA/CAN) oder 125 € (Rest of World) Insured up to 500,00 € worldwide NO ADDITIONAL FEES FOR PACKAGE AND WRAPPING! #Payment: Within Euro-zone the EU-standard-bank-transfer (SEPA, IBAN/BIC) is recommended, it´s quick, save and causes no fees. Paypal is certainly also possible, fees within EU are 0,35 Euro + 1,9% of the total. Worldwide (outside the EURO-zone) Paypal is recommended. Since October 2011 PP-fees are 0,35 Euro + (from 3,9% to 5,2%) of the total. For nearly all countries outside Europe, apart from USA and Canada (both 3,9%), the rate is 5.2%. Paypal does not allow uninsured shipment above 25 Euro and shipments to any other address than the one submitted with the payment. Thank you Daniel
Will ship USPS priority. Payment through Paypal.
